Title:
Selective sweep with significant positive selection serves as
the driving force for the differentiation of japonica and indica rice
cultivars
Keywords:
japonica; indica; wild rice; domestication; resequencing;
functional genes
Abstract:
This research promoted a new possible model of the origin
of the cultivated rice that DR-Is in japonica and indica maybe
independently originated from the divergent wild rice in the Indo-China
Peninsula to southern China, and then followed by frequent
introgression. Genes with significant positive selection and biased
functions were also detected which could play important roles in rice
domestication and differentiation processes.
